p: Missense mutations (A30P [ 40–42], A53E [ 43, 44], A53T [ 45], A53V [ 44], E46K [ 46], G51D [ 47–49], H50Q [ 50]) and copy number variations (duplication or triplication) of SNCA have been reported in PD patients [ 51, 52]. Genome-wide association studies identify SNCA as one of the genes associated with idiopathic PD, suggesting that changes in the expression level of SNCA may contribute to idiopathic PD [ 53]. Missense mutations of α-synuclein or its overexpression by copy number variations cause misfolding of the protein and its aggregation in Lewy bodies [ 37].
